content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(md, "\n"; keepempty=false)
    start = 1
    result = ""
    while true
        # Find the start of a code block
        open_code_block = findfirst(isequal("```julia"), lines, start)
        if open_code_block == nothing
            break
        end
        start = nextind(lines, open_code_block.stop + 1)

        # Find the end of a code block
        close_code_block = findfirst(isequal("```"), lines, start)
        if close_code_block == nothing
            error("Unclosed code block at line $(open_code_block.line)")
        end
        stop = close_code_block.stop - 1

        # Remove the code fences and join the content with newlines
        content = join(lines[open_code_block.line+1:stop], "\n")
        result *= strip(content)

        start = close_code_block.stop + 1
    end
    return result
end
```
